item.title: Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 33 Yonge Street, 7th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-08-02

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 3rd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Business Banking Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.description:

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Cards Analytics & Insights the Senior Manager – Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting the Cards business within Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – you will combine analytical work with domain knowledge to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth.
  • Analytics – identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends; proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Senior Manager, Business Banking Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Senior Manager, Business Banking Analytics

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Business Banking Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 33 Yonge Street, 7th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

item.title: Director, Application Development (Data Analytics & Reporting)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC’s technology transformation. As the Director, Application Development, you will act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Production Support, Development, QA and Vendor Relations for the Data Analytics & Reporting applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you’ll lead a team delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical Leadership – Drive PWM technology solutions with respect to Data Analytics & Reporting as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap. Design, develop, implement/execute and support technology strategies which include:  Data and Business Analytics strategy, Cloud strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption.  Provide oversight and leadership of end to end technology solutions involving development, business analysis, QA, vendor relations, production support and development functions supporting the business to meet their objectives.

  • People Leadership – Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Develop your team, maximizing their contributions, encourage out of the box thinking and professional growth. Create a positive work environment through being an effective role model and by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values, ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls, applying policies fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management – Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. Advise on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position.  Collaborate and support the other PWM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy.  Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery and support teams. 

 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with: 8+ years\' experience leading, designing, developing, implementing and supporting both in house applications as well as vendor developed and ASP. You have led the creation of a data strategy and associated roadmap and led execution across multiple technologies and projects. Experience in most of the following: Languages (Net, C#, C/C++, Foxpro, Python, Java, Javascript), Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase), Cloud (Azure, AWS), ETL (Informatica, SSIS), O/S (Sun Solaris, Microsoft Windows), Schedulers etc. (Feedhub, MFTS, Autosys) and Tools (source control/issue management: Git, TFS, JIRA, Azure DevOps), Data and Business Analytics, Application Modernization/CCR, Application Health-check and Innovation, Process Automation (QA) and DevOps adoption. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies. You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members. It’s an Asset if:  You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto 55 Yonge Street, 2nd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Consultant, OTC Derivatives, Regulatory Reporting Operations
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Consultant, Regulatory Operations, you will be joining the OTC Derivatives group within Capital Markets and Wealth Management Operations. You will be responsible for maintaining and enhancing the data delivery architecture surrounding operational controls for Capital Markets Regulatory trade reporting. You will participate in project activities with emphasis on using tools which automate the data capture and analysis process where applicable, including use of different tools such as SQL, Alteryx and Tableau.

You will work with stakeholders to develop a product vision that satisfies requirements. You are a creative individual who thinks about the art of the possible and executes quickly and with transparency on various process automation initiatives, achieve quick wins and milestones as part of larger project initiatives. You will apply advanced analytical skills and develop a strong understanding of derivatives data, in order to build tools which support analyzing and displaying data from multiple external and internal data sources to identify potential gaps in reporting. You are confident, thorough and have the ability to use good judgment when making decisions involving a high degree of attention to detail.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Experienced in building & applying digital technology tools - At least 3 years of experience developing workflows in Alteryx (or similar tools: Microsoft Power BI, SSIS) and building Tableau dashboards to project data in a meaningful way.
  • SQL - At least 3 years of experience building SQL queries and working with databases. Possess a University Masters or Undergraduate degree, or specialization in Computer Science, Engineering, Systems Management or equivalent
  • API - Working knowledge of APIs and integrating it with other systems and tools.
  • Data Analytical Skills -  3+ years background in data analytics leveraging state-of-the-art tools. Ability to use effective communication skills necessary to interpret and convey data that is often very technical.
  • Capital Markets Experience - Working knowledge of the structure of derivatives transactions from both a theoretical and practical viewpoint as well as the basic finance principles that underlie them. with 3-5 years of business related experience.
  • Communication & Collaboration – You have effective communication skills required to convey complex messages to business partners and executives. Understand that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one.
  • Regulation background - Awareness of Regulatory Reporting obligations, policies, and guidelines would be an asset.
  • Operational processes – background and understanding of how digital tools can help  automate data capture and automate process steps, resulting in lean processes and re-deployment of resource time on value-add activities.

Who You Are

  • You are digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends .
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-161 Bay St., 12th

Regular

Weekly Hours

item.title: Senior Manager, Digital Analytics Strategy
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Director, Digital Analytics and Integration you will be a key manager in the team responsible for implementing Data and Analytics frameworks for Digital Strategic initiatives. You will provide consultation and support to Digital programs and initiatives, and drive its implementation and enablement. You will also lead efforts to stay abreast of Digital Analytics best practices and proactively drive the implementation of these best practices, in collaboration with various cross functional teams.


How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Strategy: Provide a multi-year data and advanced analytics strategy on key Digital Projects to solve business problem clearly articulate metrics and KPIs to track and measure channel and project performances.
     
  • Data Science Expertise: Provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problem leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Ability to conduct self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems.
     
  • Data Architecture: Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders to assess, document, maintain and socialize data architecture artifacts. Develop and socialize processes to accelerate and govern access to data sources identified within data architecture along with details on key data elements, tables, views and the relationships amongst data sources.
     
  • Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners. 
     
  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs.
     
  • People Management: Lead and coach a successful team of consultants and specialists, and help them identify opportunities to build a robust data strategy and architecture that leverages their expertise across several data sources and products. Actively recognize the contributions of your team to foster a positive, collaborative and productive working environment.


Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, Hive, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as Python, SAS or R. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages such as SAS Enterprise Miner, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Keras, Matplotlib, PyTorch or SparkML.
     
  • You have extensive hands-on experience building data strategy and data architectures through collaboration with multiple teams. Experience with a Big 4 consulting firm will be considered a plus.
     
  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing in Master or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field.
     
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
     
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
     
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
     
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
     

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
     
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
     
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
     
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. item.title: Sr. Consultant, AML Analytics (Contract)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Risk Analytics and Risk Modelling is responsible for the development of analytics to measure and optimize fraud, AML and credit risk performance.  The Fraud and AML Analytics team supports the development of fraud and AML risk strategy to deliver  CIBC\'s client experience, risk management, and business growth objectives. Reporting to the Director, the Senior Manager, AML Analytics is responsible for independently leading and supporting the analytical requests of the AML compliance program and is responsible for the effectiveness of all AML data quality, accuracy and analytics. Please note this is a 3-4 Month Contract.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Quantitative Analytics– Lead the quantitative analytical work based on model risks, business needs and regulatory requirements while fostering a continuous improvement culture. Demonstrate considerable knowledge and analytic capabilities through the development of quantitative data analysis and data mining solutions, emphasizing the development of database driven reports and analyses. Maintain a high level of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools and techniques. Assesses data quality and potential impacts.
  • Technical / Data Modelling Skills– Develop rules and models that continuously improve the effectiveness of the fraud and AML transaction monitoring systems. Have the ability to translate business requirements to technical specifications for technology to implement, also have the ability to review and assess technology systems relative to business requirements. You have proven experience in the management of complex technology systems and testing and implementing changes to technological systems. You will also be required to support/participate in data quality efforts and the expansion of transaction monitoring coverage to new product types.
  • AML Expertise – Strong knowledge in AML regulations, OFAC laws, practices and economic sanctions, which may be enhanced via accreditation by ACAMS (Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists), or similar certification, or become certified within first year of employment. It’s an asset if you have working knowledge of Customer Due Diligence and Transaction Monitoring modules and anti-fraud or compliance systems.
  • Communication & Collaboration  – Manage relationships with technology partners and external vendors to ensure the systems supporting the program are operating effectively and efficiently. You have the ability to coordinate efforts within compliance teams as well as across multiple business units and possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in  analytics or technical fields (7 + years), ideally in a financial services industry, or regulatory agency or law firm involving compliance issues. SQL programming and conducting data mining, query performance and tuning. You also have a good understanding  with statistical and computer software, or other analytical tools such as SAS, R, SQL, Microsoft Word/Excel/Power Point, knowledge in UNIX or PC environment for modeling.
  • You can demonstrate experience in -   You have a degree/diploma in M.S. degree or above with emphasis in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or related quantitative fields
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. 

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: SR SPECIALIST - Outsourced Technology and Azure Cloud
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Specialist - Outsourced Technology and Azure Cloud, you will be supporting the financial and contractual governance of our outsourced technology and Azure cloud infrastructure services.  You will use a variety of tools and processes to create meaningful analytics from both structured and unstructured data.  These outputs will be used to provide effective decision support guidance for our internal partners and senior executives.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Information Technology Outsourcing and Azure Cloud – Must have previous experience with, and a working understanding of outsourced information technology and Azure cloud infrastructure.

  • Financial Management Expertise – Must have prior work experience with core financial management and accounting activities such as planning, forecasting, accruals, and financial variance reporting. 

  • Data Engineering and Data Science – Must have an awareness of current tools and methods used to support data engineering and data science analytics to provide insight and decision support for Senior Executives and management within CIBC.

  • Creative Problem Solving – Demonstrated ability to thrive in ambiguity, understand business context quickly and connect the dots. Must be comfortable operating at a strategic level and also driving into detail as needed, and back. Continuous improvement is part of your DNA.

Who You Are

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-483 Bay St, 5th floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Director, Application Development (Trading Platform)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC’s technology transformation. As the Director, Application Development, you will act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Production Support, Development, QA and Vendor Relations for the Trading Platform applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you’ll lead a team delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical Leadership – Drive PWM technology solutions with respect to Trading Platforms across numerous Tier 1 applications which either directly support Advisors or are a critical element in the overall ecosystem as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap. Design, develop, implement/execute and support technology strategies which include:  Cloud strategy, Data and Business Analytics strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption.  Provide oversight and leadership of end to end technology solutions involving development, business analysis, QA, vendor relations, production support and development functions supporting the business to meet their objectives.

  • People Leadership – Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Develop your team, maximizing their contributions, encourage out of the box thinking and professional growth. Create a positive work environment through being an effective role model and by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values, ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls, applying policies fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management – Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. Advise on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position.  Collaborate and support the other PWM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy.  Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery and support teams. 

 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with: 8+ years\' experience leading, designing, developing, implementing and supporting both in house applications as well as vendor developed and ASP. Experience and deep knowledge of trading platforms, books of record, messaging platforms, and market-related ecosystems. Experience in most of the following: Languages (Net, C#, C/C++, Foxpro, Python, Java, Javascript), Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase), Cloud (Azure, AWS), ETL (Informatica, SSIS), O/S (Sun Solaris, Microsoft Windows), Schedulers etc. (Feedhub, MFTS, Autosys) and Tools (source control/issue management: Git, TFS, JIRA, Azure DevOps), Data and Business Analytics, Application Modernization/CCR, Application Health-check and Innovation, Process Automation (QA) and DevOps adoption. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies. You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members. It’s an Asset if:  You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

55 Yonge St., 9th Fl.

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC’s technology transformation. As the Director, Application Development, you will act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Production Support, Development, QA and Vendor Relations for the Client Management applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you’ll lead a team delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical Leadership – Drive PWM technology solutions with respect to Client Management applications including onboarding, practice management, fees and bills, goal planning, and associated Advisor desktop tools as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap. Design, develop, implement/execute and support technology strategies which include:  Cloud strategy, Data and Business Analytics strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption.  Provide oversight and leadership of end to end technology solutions involving development, business analysis, QA, vendor relations, production support and development functions supporting the business to meet their objectives.

  • People Leadership – Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management – Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. This portfolio includes numerous small vendor applications so experience working with vendors, developing MSAs, SOWs, and operationalizing contracts is required. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies. You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members. It’s an Asset if:  You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
